The Browsers text input width changes, if the user selects a different application font in gnome desktop manager. With some non system fonts e.g "Lucida Grande" the default input width is much wider than normal and destroys the page layout. This only affects input elements without a defined width by using css or an attribute.

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Change the "Application Font" in System->Preferences->Appearance
2. Visit a Website which uses input form elements without a defined with
Actual Results:  
With most fonts there are only small changes visible. In such a case the default width of the input element is about 140px. With a font like "Lucida Grande" the width increases to 340px.  

Expected Results:  
Input elements widthout a defined style should all have the same width. 

Here are two screenshots which demonstrate the behaviour between the font Arial and Lucida Grande.

Arial:
http://www.imagebanana.com/view/inuealy2/arial.png

Lucida Grande:
http://www.imagebanana.com/view/sww1433j/lucida.png
